  • Constructor Details

    • Document

      public Document(String documentName, String documentDate, String storageAddress, String category, String topic) throws ParseException
      Create a Document instance with the document name, document date, storage address, category and topic
      Parameters:
      documentName - Name of the document
      documentDate - Date of the document
      storageAddress - Storage address of the document
      category - Category of the document
      topic - Topic of the document
      Throws:
      ParseException - If the date format is not yyyy-MM-dd

    • Document

      public Document(String documentName)
      Create a blank Document instance with only the document name
      Parameters:
      documentName - Name of the document

    • Document

      protected Document(int documentID) throws Exception
      Create a document with a given ID. Use only for internal methods that requires creation of Document with specific ID.
      Parameters:
      documentID - Id of the document
      Throws:
      Exception - If the Id is greater or equal than the internal counter

    • sync

      public void sync(Connection con) throws SQLException
      Synchronize data of the current Document instance into the database
      Parameters:
      con - Connection to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - If category and topic are null, or there is any SQL error occurs during the synchronization

    • fetchDocument

      public static Document fetchDocument(Connection con, int docId) throws Exception
      Search in the database for a document with a given ID, which then generate an instance of Document with its data
      Parameters:
      con - Connection to the database
      docId - Id of the document
      Returns:
      An instance of Document corresponding to the Id
      Throws:
      ParseException - If the document date is not yyyy-MM-dd
      SQLException - If there is any SQL error happening
      Exception - If the document ID is greater than the internal counter
